page.title: 20EDUCATION IN YATTON
page.content: There are three educational establishments in Yatton, Yatton Infants School, Yatton Junior School, and Linden House, a very small private achool. In l985 the Infants School has 235 children, 8 teachers and a headmistress. It is housed in temporary classrooms surrounding a large Victorian building which is used as a hall and gym. The Junior School has 36l pupils, l2 teachers and a headmaster, Mr J.E. Burgess who has been with the school since it opened in l967. Mr Burgess is retiring this year. At the age of ll the children go out of the village to start their secondary education at Backwell Comprehensive School. The entries for the Domesday project for Yatton were compiled by teachers and children from Yatton Junior School.
